<url>http://www.lsoft.com/images/listserv_small.gif</url> </image>   <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;128cb29a.1503">   <title>FW: Yorkshire African Studies Conference-Call for Papers </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;128cb29a.1503</link>   <description> Yorkshire African Studies Network Conference 2015<br><br>Family, Community and Livelihoods: Perspectives from Africa<br><br>19 May 2015, University of Sheffield<br><br>Recent years have seen impressive levels of economic growth in many parts of Africa, with a new discourse of 'Africa Rising' coming to displace the widespread pessimism of the late twentieth century. 2015 is also the year in which countries across the continent will be scrutinised regarding their achievements or failures in relation to the 'Milliennium Development Goals'. In this one-day conference, we seek to go beyond statistics and national indicators to understand contemporary African societies in rich detail and at [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-04T15:08:11+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Nicola Ansell</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;128cb29a.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;e541d8b.1502">   <title>MA in Children, Youth and International Development </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;e541d8b.1502</link>   <description> Apologies for cross-posting. Please forward this to anyone you know who might be interested.<br>Many thanks<br>Nicola.    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-12T11:32:20+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Nicola Ansell</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;e541d8b.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;5e99f1b4.1501">   <title>Fwd: Children, Youth and Environments: new papers just published </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;5e99f1b4.1501</link>   <description> *Children, Youth and Environments *has just published a new issue, now<br>available on:<br><br>http://www.jstor.org/action/showPublication?journalCode=chilyoutenvi<br><br>It contains a special section on *Greening Early Childhood Education*,<br>which continues the 2014(2) special issue on this theme, and additional<br>papers on *environmental health, sense of place, and neighborhood<br>perceptions (see below)*.<br><br>It also includes field reports with lessons from practice and book reviews. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-16T14:29:26-07:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Children, Youth and Environments</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;5e99f1b4.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;621f5118.1501">   <title>COMING SOON: Boyhood Studies - An Interdisciplinary Journal </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;621f5118.1501</link>   <description> Dear Colleague,<br><br>In the summer of 2015, Berghahn Journals will launch a new journal that we think will be of particular interest to the members of this list: Boyhood Studies: An Interdisciplinary Journal.<br><br>Boyhood Studies: An Interdisciplinary Journal is a peer-reviewed journal providing a forum for the discussion of boyhood, young masculinities, and boys\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd lives by exploring the full scale of intricacies, challenges, and legacies that inform male and masculine developments. It is committed to a critical and international scope and solicits both articles and special issue proposals from a variety of research fields. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-14T19:34:19+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Young Lee</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;621f5118.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;28e7bef5.1501">   <title>CfP: Boyhood Studies: An Interdisciplinary Journal </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;28e7bef5.1501</link>   <description> (apologies for X-posting)<br><br>*Boyhood Studies: An Interdisciplinary Journal *is a peer-reviewed journal<br>providing a forum for the discussion of boyhood, young masculinities, and<br>boys\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd lives by exploring the full scale of intricacies, challenges, and<br>legacies that inform male and masculine developments. Boyhood Studies is<br>committed to a critical and international scope and solicits both articles<br>and special issue proposals from a variety of research fields including,<br>but not limited to, the social and psychological sciences, historical and<br>cultural studies, philosophy, social policy studies, and social health<br>studies. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-07T00:57:45+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>BHS</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;28e7bef5.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;eb6758dc.1412">   <title>New in paperback: Geographies of alternative education by Peter Kraftl </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;eb6758dc.1412</link>   <description> ***Apologies for cross-posting***<br><br>Now in paperback from Policy Press<br><br>*\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdGeographies of alternative education: Diverse learning spaces for<br>children and young people\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd by Peter Kraftl*<br><br>*Paperback ISBN: 978-1-4473-0050-2 \ufffd\ufffd24.99*<br><br>This title is available at 20% discount<br>&lt;http://www.policypress.co.uk/display.asp?K=9781447300502&gt;.<br><br>*&quot;...The book\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds appeal is its recognition of diverse economic and<br>autonomous practices, non-representational geographies, and the politics of<br>life-itself, which, combined, dismantle any sense of a simple binary<br>between \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdalternative\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd and \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdmainstream\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd education.&quot;* Youth &amp; Policy [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-09T12:31:58+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Kathryn King</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;eb6758dc.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;dd9f7f6b.1410">   <title>Final Reminder: 1 more paper sought for AAG 2015 Chicago - "Education, Faith and Place" </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;dd9f7f6b.1410</link>   <description> Final Reminder: 1 more paper sought for double session at: American Association of Geographers (AAG) Annual Meeting, 21-25 April 2015, Chicago<br><br>Session Title: &quot;Education, Faith and Place&quot;<br><br>Organiser: Peter Hemming (Cardiff University)<br><br>The role of faith in education is an issue that often features prominently in media and policy debates in a range of national contexts. In the UK, this was demonstrated most recently in relation to the so-called 'Trojan Horse letter', which involved an alleged plot to install Islamist governors in a number of Birmingham state schools. Similar scenarios are found across the world, from resistance to new Islamic [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-31T18:17:00+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Peter Hemming</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;dd9f7f6b.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;d26ff246.1410">   <title>Reminder: 'Intergenerational and life course geographies in times of crisis', CFP AAG 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;d26ff246.1410</link>   <description> This is just a reminder of our CFP for the following session - and thanks again to those who have submitted an abstract.<br><br>** Apologies for cross-posting; the topic may be of interest to some list members**<br><br>'Intergenerational and life course geographies in times of crisis' paper session<br><br>AAG Annual Meeting, Chicago, Illinois, 21-25 April 2015 [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-30T10:28:12+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Helena Pimlott-Wilson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;d26ff246.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;c0ad93ca.1410">   <title>1 more paper sought for double session at AAG 2015 Chicago - "Education, Faith and Place" </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;c0ad93ca.1410</link>   <description> 1 more paper sought for double session at: American Association of Geographers (AAG) Annual Meeting, 21-25 April 2015, Chicago<br><br>Session Title: &quot;Education, Faith and Place&quot;<br><br>Organiser: Peter Hemming (Cardiff University)<br><br>The role of faith in education is an issue that often features prominently in media and policy debates in a range of national contexts. In the UK, this was demonstrated most recently in relation to the so-called 'Trojan Horse letter', which involved an alleged plot to install Islamist governors in a number of Birmingham state schools. Similar scenarios are found across the world, from resistance to new Islamic schools in [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-29T08:45:05+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Peter Hemming</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;c0ad93ca.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;e258854a.1410">   <title>3 x ESRC PhD studentships in contemporary childhoods at Cardiff SOCSI </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;e258854a.1410</link>   <description> Applications are invited for three fully-funded MSc &amp; PhD/ PhD studentships to undertake research projects that use creative and participatory methodologies in the area of contemporary childhoods, culture and identity to begin in October 2015. Three core and interdisciplinary fields of study have been identified to guide applicants' research ideas: [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-27T12:01:33+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Peter Hemming</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;e258854a.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;7a6e53a1.1410">   <title>FINAL Call for Papers AAG 2015 Chicago - "Education, Faith and Place" </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;7a6e53a1.1410</link>   <description> FINAL Call for Papers: American Association of Geographers (AAG) Annual Meeting, 21-25 April 2015, Chicago<br><br>Session Title: &quot;Education, Faith and Place&quot;<br><br>Organiser: Peter Hemming (Cardiff University)<br><br>The role of faith in education is an issue that often features prominently in media and policy debates in a range of national contexts. In the UK, this was demonstrated most recently in relation to the so-called 'Trojan Horse letter', which involved an alleged plot to install Islamist governors in a number of Birmingham state schools. Similar scenarios are found across the world, from resistance to new Islamic schools in Australia (Bugg & Gurran [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-26T13:39:38+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Peter Hemming</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;7a6e53a1.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;6fc62d96.1410">   <title>FW: How to Improve Children\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Health \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Putting Research Into Practice</title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;6fc62d96.1410</link>   <description> Forwarded on behalf of Rebecca Sparkes:<br><br>-----Original Message-----<br>From: Rebecca Sparkes [mailto:rebecca@CUMBERLANDLODGE.AC.UK]<br>Sent: 21 October 2014 15:58<br>To: CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: How to Improve Children\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Health \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Putting Research Into Practice<br><br>***Conference Announcement***<br><br>Conference Title: How to Improve Children\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Health \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Putting Research Into Practice<br><br>"There is a growing knowledge of the complex interplay between psychosocial events and biological factors, and we now understand that events that occur as a fetus and in early life play a fundamental part in later life, and indeed in the lives of future generations...The challenge for us as a society is how to harness this [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-22T12:41:12+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Nicola Ansell</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;6fc62d96.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;8d79e16d.1410">   <title>Call for Papers AAG 2015 Chicago - "Education, Faith and Place" </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;8d79e16d.1410</link>   <description> Call for Papers: American Association of Geographers (AAG) Annual Meeting, 21-25 April 2015, Chicago<br><br>Session Title: &quot;Education, Faith and Place&quot;<br><br>Organiser: Peter Hemming (Cardiff University)<br><br>The role of faith in education is an issue that often features prominently in media and policy debates in a range of national contexts. In the UK, this was demonstrated most recently in relation to the so-called 'Trojan Horse letter', which involved an alleged plot to install Islamist governors in a number of Birmingham state schools. Similar scenarios are found across the world, from resistance to new Islamic schools in Australia (Bugg & Gurran 2011), [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-17T21:39:54+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Peter Hemming</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;8d79e16d.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;24efdd3b.1410">   <title>Fwd: FW: Greening Early Childhood Education, CYE Journal Vol. 24, No. 2 is now available online </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;24efdd3b.1410</link>   <description> Greening Early Childhood Education is now available online<br><br>Volume 24(2), 2014<br><br>Guest editors<br><br>Patti Bailie, University of Maine Farmington<br><br>Nancy Rosenow, Dimensions Educational Research Foundation<br><br>For article access and subscription information:<br><br>www.jstor.org/page/journal/chilyoutenvi/about.html<br><br>http://www.jstor.org/stable/10.7721/chilyoutenvi.24.issue-2<br><br>This special issue explores outcomes associated with bringing nature into<br>the settings of child care centers, preschools and kindergartens and<br>describes a variety of ways to do this in practice. Seven research articles<br>review the literature on benefits that children gain from engagement with<br>nature, evaluate the impacts of naturalized school grounds and nature<br>kindergartens on children\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds development, and examine education for<br>sustainability in early childhood programs. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-10T14:37:29-06:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Children, Youth and Environments</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;24efdd3b.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;fdd02dda.1410">   <title>FW: Ethics and Education Research </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;fdd02dda.1410</link>   <description> Forwarded on behalf of Rachel Brooks:<br><br>****Apologies for cross-posting****<br><br>ETHICS AND EDUCATION RESEARCH<br><br>Friday, 30th January 2015<br><br>Lecture Theatre J, Lecture Theatre Block,<br><br>University of Surrey<br><br>CALL FOR PAPERS<br><br>This seminar, supported by the British Sociological Association’s Education Study Group, aims to bring together researchers, from all career stages, who are interested in exploring further the ethics of education research. We welcome papers that focus on any ethical issue(s) relating to conducting education research, including, but not limited to: [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-10T08:51:07+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Nicola Ansell</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;fdd02dda.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;ae5250ca.1409">   <title>Reigniting the youth labour market - one-day conference </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;ae5250ca.1409</link>   <description> Apologies for any cross-posting<br><br>Reigniting the youth labour market&lt;http://www.employment-studies.co.uk/events/251114.php&gt;<br>Institute for Employment Studies one-day conference<br><br>Keynote speaker: Stephen Timms, Shadow Minister for Employment<br><br>What can be done to increase the chances of young people gaining secure employment, particularly those with low qualification levels?<br><br>Speakers<br><br>* Chair: Jim Hillage, IES<br>* Ian Brinkley, The Work Foundation<br>* Alvin Carpio, UpRising Leadership Programme<br>* Massimiliano Mascherini, Eurofound<br>* Becci Newton, IES<br>* Professor Jackie O'Reilly, University of The studentship provides home/EU tuition fees, a research training allowance and overseas fieldwork costs for the duration of the studentship. The maintenance [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-07-25T12:36:20+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Lorraine van Blerk</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;8be59dcd.1407</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;350b9286.1407">   <title>Professor of Geography post </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHILD-YOUTH-GEOSOCIAL-ENV;350b9286.1407</link>   <description> ****Apologies for cross-posting****<br><br>Dear All,<br><br>Please see details below for a vacancy for a Professor of Geography at the University of Surrey.<br><br>Best wishes,<br>Rachel Brooks<br><br>The University of Surrey is investing in a new Department of Geography, to be located in its School of Social Sciences alongside the Department of Sociology and the Department of Politics. We are seeking an ambitious Human Geographer with the academic standing and strategic vision to be a credible and inspirational leader for this new department. You will have research strengths in any area of Human Geography and experience of leadership and management. San Diego. January 12-15, 2015 ( http://icgcsandiego.wix.com/ypbw<br>)<br><br>Paper Session Organizers: Lia Karsten and Willem van Vliet<br><br>Session theme: Childfriendly cities: critical approaches<br><br>Many of the papers within children\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds geographies end with some kind of<br>recommendation for the building of childfriendly cities. But what do we<br>mean by childfriendly cities? In this workshop we want to explore different<br>ways of conceptualizing children, cities, childfriendliness and their<br>interrelationships.
